Chapter 3 Basic tools In this Chapter, we present basic tools that will be important when interacting with big data systems, most importantly the command-line interface (CLI) in a Unix shell and several utilities (less, vi, awk and make). 3.1 Command line tools We assume some familiarity with the Unix shell, for example as in http://swcarpentry.github.io/shell-novice/. We also assume that you have access to a shell, either because you use Linux or OS X or because you have the right tools on Windows (for example Cygwin or the Bash shell in Windows 10). 3.1.1 Why use the command line?
